alert.note: Alert for Kings; Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 12:03PM PST until March 10 at 11:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Kings and Tulare. * WHEN...Until midnight PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1203 PM PST, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Visalia, Tulare, Farmersville, Ivanhoe and Goshen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
